name: TIFF (Tagged Image File Format), Revision 6.0
extras: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><metadata><field name="disclosure">www.digitalpreservation.gov/formats/fdd/</field><field name="documentation">http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/tiff/index.html, http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/tiff/TIFF6.pdf, http://www.npes.org/pdf/TIFF-v6.pdf, http://cool.conservation-us.org/bytopic/imaging/std/tiff5.html, http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/tiff/TIFFPM6.pdf, http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/tiff/TIFFphotoshop.pdf</field><field name="filenameExtension">tif, tiff</field><field name="internetMediaType"></field><field name="pronomPUID"></field></metadata>
description: A tag-based file format for storing and interchanging raster images. TIFF serves as a wrapper for different bitstream encodings for bit-mapped (raster) images. The different encodings may represent different compression schemes and different schemes for color representation (photometric interpretation).
